intro: Lasianthaea palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's lasianthaea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
